trial_identification.studytitle: The Burden of Influenza in Children under 5 years Admitted to the Children Hospital at Westmead 2006
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The Burden of Influenza in Children under 5 years Admitted to the Children Hospital at Westmead 2006

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Studies of infection and infectious agents

interventions.interventions: Observational study; no intervention. The incidence of influenza hospitalisation in children under 5 years during the period June to October 2006.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Parental time off work. Secondary infection.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Children under 5 years Temp > 37.8 Hospital admission Respiratory symptoms
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Respiratory symptoms more than 15 days duration. Children who did not leave hospital since birth.

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: National Centre for Immunisation, Research and Surveillance The Children Hospital at Westmead Corner of Hawkesbury and Hainsworth Street Westmead NSW 2145

fundingsource.fundingaddress: Talavera Corporate Centre Building D 12-24 Talavera Road Macquarie Park NSW 2113

secondarysponsor.sponsorname: Department of Infectious Diseases and Microbiology
secondarysponsor.sponsoraddress: The Children Hospital at Westmead Corner of Hawkesbury and Hainsworth Street Westmead NSW 2145

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The aim of the study is to prospectively measure the morbidity in children under 5 years of age hospitalised with influenza as well as the indirect burden on their families during one influenza season. This enhanced surveillance data will serve to accurately assess the cost effectiveness of influenza vaccination in young children.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: The Children Hospital at Westmead Ethics Committee
ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: The Children Hospital at Westmead Corner of Hawkesbury and Hainsworth Street Westmead NSW 2145
